long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1320980
symbolic icon (SVG)

GNOME 3 prefers to have a monochrome symbolic icon for display at the top bar, rather than the standard icon. Fedora's packaging of Firefox has added this, but Thunderbird has not.

Attached is a similar symbolic icon for Thunderbird, which hopefully can be added to the rpm. :)
Thanks, I hope TB folks don't mind that. Jan, can you please add it?

This message is a reminder that Fedora 25 is nearing its end of life.
Approximately 4 (four) weeks from now Fedora will stop maintaining
and issuing updates for Fedora 25. It is Fedora's policy to close all
bug reports from releases that are no longer maintained. At that time
this bug will be closed as EOL if it remains open with a Fedora  'version'
of '25'.

Package Maintainer: If you wish for this bug to remain open because you
plan to fix it in a currently maintained version, simply change the 'version'
to a later Fedora version.

Thank you for reporting this issue and we are sorry that we were not
able to fix it before Fedora 25 is end of life. If you would still like
to see this bug fixed and are able to reproduce it against a later version
of Fedora, you are encouraged  change the 'version' to a later Fedora
version prior this bug is closed as described in the policy above.

Although we aim to fix as many bugs as possible during every release's
lifetime, sometimes those efforts are overtaken by events. Often a
more recent Fedora release includes newer upstream software that fixes
bugs or makes them obsolete.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 28 development cycle.
Changing version to '28'.
Ping?

bugs.title: known bug in thunderbird 68.2.0 with gmail accounts

bugzilla.short_desc: known bug in thunderbird 68.2.0 with gmail accounts

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

Thunderbird 68.2.0 has a bug that causes problems with gmail email accounts.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):

68.2.0

How reproducible:

Always for me, but may not be a problem for everyone

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add gmail account to thunderbird
2.
3.

Actual results:

An authentication error is signalled even when everything should be OK.

Expected results:

Email account set up correctly.

Additional info:

This is a known bug, and is fixed in 68.2.1, so this report is just a plea to push thunderbird 68.2.1 out as quickly as possible.  

See the release notes for thunderbird 68.2.1 https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/68.2.1/releasenotes/ where there is a short note saying that the problem has been fixed.
